arlut.csd.ganymede.common
Interface InvidAllocator

All Known Implementing Classes:
InvidPool
public interface InvidAllocator

This interface is used by the Invid class to provide an Invid when given a short type number and an int object number. By using an InvidAllocator, the server will be able to reuse previously created Invid's, much as the JVM can reuse interned strings.

Method Summary
 Invid findInvid(Invid matchInvid)
          This method takes the identifying elements of an Invid to be found, and searches to find a suitable Invid object to return.
 void storeInvid(Invid newInvid)
          This method takes the invid given and places in whatever storage mechanism is appropriate, if any, for findInvid() to later draw upon.
 

Method Detail

findInvid

Invid findInvid(Invid matchInvid)

This method takes the identifying elements of an Invid to be found, and searches to find a suitable Invid object to return. If one cannot found, null should be returned, in which case createInvid will synthesize and return a new one.

storeInvid

void storeInvid(Invid newInvid)

This method takes the invid given and places in whatever storage mechanism is appropriate, if any, for findInvid() to later draw upon.
